definition[0]: a very successful and popular English football club from Manchester who play their home games at a stadium called Old Trafford. In 1999, Manchester United became the first club to win the European Cup, the FA Cup, and the Premier League competition in one season. It has won the Premier League and the FA Cup many times, and has also won the UEFA Champions League. The team's nickname is The Red Devils. Its full name is Manchester United Football Club (MUFC).
